Comment: Alienable possessive constructions use a free possessor pronoun and cannot use a possessive suffix. Inalienable possessive constructions use a possessor suffix and an optional free pronoun.
Only in case of a pronominal possessor, then the order of inalienable constructions is possessee-possessor, whereas the order of alienable constructions is possessor-possessee.
